title: Dragon (SLASH'EM)
data:
In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), the **[dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon")** [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") is significantly changed from *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 List of dragons](#List_of_dragons)
  - [1.1 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
- [2 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [2.1 Generation](#Generation)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 As pets](#As_pets)
- [4 References](#References)

## List of dragons

The following dragons are present in SLASH'EM, with new monsters highlighted in bold:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- Adult dragons

  - D [gray dragon](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon")
  - D [silver dragon](/wiki/Silver_dragon "Silver dragon")
  - D [red dragon](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon")
  - D [white dragon](/wiki/White_dragon "White dragon")
  - D [orange dragon](/wiki/Orange_dragon "Orange dragon")
  - D [black dragon](/wiki/Black_dragon "Black dragon")
  - D [blue dragon](/wiki/Blue_dragon "Blue dragon")
  - D [green dragon](/wiki/Green_dragon "Green dragon")
  - D [yellow dragon](/wiki/Yellow_dragon "Yellow dragon")
  - **D [shimmering dragon](/wiki/Shimmering_dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Shimmering dragon (SLASH'EM)")**
  - **D [deep dragon](/wiki/Deep_dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Deep dragon (SLASH'EM)")**

- Baby dragons

  - D [baby gray dragon](/wiki/Baby_gray_dragon "Baby gray dragon")
  - D [baby silver dragon](/wiki/Baby_silver_dragon "Baby silver dragon")
  - D [baby red dragon](/wiki/Baby_red_dragon "Baby red dragon")
  - D [baby white dragon](/wiki/Baby_white_dragon "Baby white dragon")
  - D [baby orange dragon](/wiki/Baby_orange_dragon "Baby orange dragon")
  - D [baby black dragon](/wiki/Baby_black_dragon "Baby black dragon")
  - D [baby blue dragon](/wiki/Baby_blue_dragon "Baby blue dragon")
  - D [baby green dragon](/wiki/Baby_green_dragon "Baby green dragon")
  - D [baby yellow dragon](/wiki/Baby_yellow_dragon "Baby yellow dragon")
  - **D [baby shimmering dragon](/wiki/Baby_shimmering_dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Baby shimmering dragon (SLASH'EM)")**
  - **D [baby deep dragon](/wiki/Baby_deep_dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Baby deep dragon (SLASH'EM)")**

- Other dragons

  - **D [wyvern](/wiki/Wyvern "Wyvern")**
  - **D [hydra](/wiki/Hydra "Hydra")**

- [Unique monsters](/wiki/Unique_monster "Unique monster")

  - D [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon")
  - D [Ixoth](/wiki/Ixoth "Ixoth")

- Deferred monster
  - D [Smaug](/wiki/Smaug "Smaug")

### SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the monsters listed above and adds the following to the monster class:

- Adult dragons

  - D [golden dragon](/index.php?title=Golden_dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Golden dragon (page does not exist)")
  - D [stone dragon](/wiki/Stone_dragon "Stone dragon")

- Baby dragons

  - D [baby golden dragon](/index.php?title=Baby_golden_dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Baby golden dragon (page does not exist)")
  - D [baby stone dragon](/wiki/Baby_stone_dragon "Baby stone dragon")

- Other dragons

  - D [ancient multi-hued dragon](/index.php?title=Ancient_multi-hued_dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ancient multi-hued dragon (page does not exist)")
  - D [undead dragon](/index.php?title=Undead_dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Undead dragon (page does not exist)")
  - D [Dragon Lord](/index.php?title=Dragon_Lord\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragon Lord (page does not exist)")
  - D [Alduin](/index.php?title=Alduin\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Alduin (page does not exist)")

## Common traits

All of the dragons from *NetHack* (including the un-[deferred](/wiki/Deferred "Deferred") [shimmering dragon](/wiki/Shimmering_dragon "Shimmering dragon")) have their stats improved: the baby dragons have their base [monster level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level") lowered to 4 from 12, and their [difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") is lowered to 5 or 6 from 13; adult dragons have their base level raised to 15 from 18, their difficulty is typically raised to 25, their melee attacks are made stronger, and exclusively in SlashTHEM, the first claw attack is also replaced with a lashing attack. The newly added dragons that have adult and baby forms follow the same patterns in both cases.

Most baby dragons in both SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM [hit as +1 weapons](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon") with the exception of baby deep, silver and shimmering dragons, while most adult dragons in both variants hit as +3 weapons with the exception of silver and shimmering dragons; of the newly-introduced dragons that lack baby forms, the hydra, wyvern and undead dragon all hit as +2 weapons.

Chaotic adult dragons have a chance of turning [traitor](/wiki/Traitor "Traitor") while [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame"), while lawful adult dragons with the exception of the orange dragon do not.

### Generation

All randomly-generated dragons are normally created [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").

Baby dragons can randomly generate on ordinary dungeon levels with a [frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency") of 2: in *NetHack*, they are only generated in aligned dungeon levels and branches such as the [Oracle](/wiki/Oracle "Oracle") and the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines"). Being randomly generated also makes baby dragons eligible to appear on any of the levels that generate D at level creation. Adult dragons have their frequency raised to 3 in order to balance their increased difficulty so that they are not as relatively rare.

As in *NetHack*, hostile dragons can be generated in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room"), and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Various dragons also appear in [dragon lairs](/wiki/Dragon_lair "Dragon lair") and [the Wyrm Caves](/wiki/The_Wyrm_Caves "The Wyrm Caves").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Strategy

Several of the listed changes to dragons and overall changes to mechanics such as [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph#SLASH.27EM "Polymorph") make the stronger dragons harder to encounter reliably and make procuring [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail") from them much more difficult as well: polymorphed monsters return to their previous form when killed, and baby dragons take much longer to [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") to adulthood, making it impractical for a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") to raise them solely for their [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales"). This leaves [reverse genocide](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide") and [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") as some of the more reliable means to procure dragon scales or scale mail.

The addition of new dragon scale and dragon scale mail types also make certain dragons more desirable to seek out: [deep dragon scales](/wiki/Deep_dragon_scales "Deep dragon scales") and [deep dragon scale mail](/wiki/Deep_dragon_scale_mail "Deep dragon scale mail") in particular grant [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") while worn, which make them an ideal counter to the many additional sources of [level drain](/wiki/Level_drain "Level drain") in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, e.g. the [wand of draining](/wiki/Wand_of_draining "Wand of draining"). [Yellow dragon scales](/wiki/Yellow_dragon_scales "Yellow dragon scales") and [yellow dragon scale mail](/wiki/Yellow_dragon_scale_mail "Yellow dragon scale mail") also become much more desirable due to the presence of much stronger acidic monsters such as the [giant shoggoth](/wiki/Giant_shoggoth "Giant shoggoth").

### As pets

While dragons are generally better pets than in *NetHack*, the difference in base level between baby and adult dragons make it much harder for tame baby dragons to gain enough experience to grow up into adults. The [rat level](/wiki/Rat_level "Rat level") has several weak and slow monsters that pets can gain experience from with little risk, though the stronger monsters such as [the Rat King](/wiki/The_Rat_King_\(SLASH%27EM\) "The Rat King (SLASH'EM)") and [rabid rats](/wiki/Rabid_rat "Rabid rat") can still pose a danger to a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero")'s pets or the hero themselves.

Dragon (SLASH'EM)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, the dragon monster class is significantly changed from NetHack.

List of dragons

The following dragons are present in SLASH'EM, with new monsters highlighted in bold:[1]

  • Adult dragons
    • D gray dragon
    • D silver dragon
    • D red dragon
    • D white dragon
    • D orange dragon
    • D black dragon
    • D blue dragon
    • D green dragon
    • D yellow dragon
    • D shimmering dragon
    • D deep dragon
  • Baby dragons
    • D baby gray dragon
    • D baby silver dragon
    • D baby red dragon
    • D baby white dragon
    • D baby orange dragon
    • D baby black dragon
    • D baby blue dragon
    • D baby green dragon

    • D baby shimmering dragon

  • Other dragons
    • D wyvern
    • D hydra
  • Unique monsters
    • D Chromatic Dragon
    • D Ixoth
  • Deferred monster
    • D Smaug

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the monsters listed above and adds the following to the monster class:

  • Adult dragons
    • D golden dragon
    • D stone dragon
  • Baby dragons
    • D baby golden dragon
    • D baby stone dragon
  • Other dragons
    • D ancient multi-hued dragon
    • D undead dragon
    • D Dragon Lord
    • D Alduin

Common traits

All of the dragons from NetHack (including the un-deferred shimmering dragon) have their stats improved: the baby dragons have their base monster level lowered to 4 from 12, and their difficulty is lowered to 5 or 6 from 13; adult dragons have their base level raised to 15 from 18, their difficulty is typically raised to 25, their melee attacks are made stronger, and exclusively in SlashTHEM, the first claw attack is also replaced with a lashing attack. The newly added dragons that have adult and baby forms follow the same patterns in both cases.

Most baby dragons in both SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM hit as +1 weapons with the exception of baby deep, silver and shimmering dragons, while most adult dragons in both variants hit as +3 weapons with the exception of silver and shimmering dragons; of the newly-introduced dragons that lack baby forms, the hydra, wyvern and undead dragon all hit as +2 weapons.

Chaotic adult dragons have a chance of turning traitor while tame, while lawful adult dragons with the exception of the orange dragon do not.

Generation

All randomly-generated dragons are normally created hostile.

Baby dragons can randomly generate on ordinary dungeon levels with a frequency of 2: in NetHack, they are only generated in aligned dungeon levels and branches such as the Oracle and the Gnomish Mines. Being randomly generated also makes baby dragons eligible to appear on any of the levels that generate D at level creation. Adult dragons have their frequency raised to 3 in order to balance their increased difficulty so that they are not as relatively rare.

As in NetHack, hostile dragons can be generated in throne rooms, and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by looting a throne while confused and carrying gold (provided there is no chest on the level).[2] Various dragons also appear in dragon lairs and the Wyrm Caves.[3]

Strategy

Several of the listed changes to dragons and overall changes to mechanics such as polymorph make the stronger dragons harder to encounter reliably and make procuring dragon scale mail from them much more difficult as well: polymorphed monsters return to their previous form when killed, and baby dragons take much longer to grow up to adulthood, making it impractical for a hero to raise them solely for their dragon scales. This leaves reverse genocide and wishing as some of the more reliable means to procure dragon scales or scale mail.

The addition of new dragon scale and dragon scale mail types also make certain dragons more desirable to seek out: deep dragon scales and deep dragon scale mail in particular grant drain resistance while worn, which make them an ideal counter to the many additional sources of level drain in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM, e.g. the wand of draining. Yellow dragon scales and yellow dragon scale mail also become much more desirable due to the presence of much stronger acidic monsters such as the giant shoggoth.

As pets

While dragons are generally better pets than in NetHack, the difference in base level between baby and adult dragons make it much harder for tame baby dragons to gain enough experience to grow up into adults. The rat level has several weak and slow monsters that pets can gain experience from with little risk, though the stronger monsters such as the Rat King and rabid rats can still pose a danger to a hero's pets or the hero themselves.
